str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A state, commonwealth. From politeuomai; a community, i.e. citizenship.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
